Error:org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException: Could not execute build using Gradle installation 'C:\Users\TanawatL.gradle\wrapper\dists\gradle-1.11-all\7qd8qq8te5j4f5q9aaei3gh3lj\gradle-1.11'.: Could not execute build using Gradle installation 'C:\Users\TanawatL.gradle\wrapper\dists\gradle-1.11-all\7qd8qq8te5j4f5q9aaei3gh3lj\gradle-1.11'.

hmmm  what should I do. ? Thanks everyone

data.title: Changes in gdx.math
data.body:
Hello. Here I commited some changes in math package. 
Circle, Rectangle, Ellipse, Polygon are extends Shape now.
Ellipse and Rectangle are also extends RectangleBased.
For now you can do something like that:
`boolean isPointInShape(Shape shape, Vector2 point) { return shape.contains(point); }`
or 
`void moveAllShapesTo(List<Shape> shapes, Vector2 point) { for(Shape shape : shapes) shape.setPosition(point); }`
and so on.
But it's have not implemented contains(Ellipse) & overlaps(Ellipse) in Ellipse.java and contains(Polygon) & overlaps(Polygon) in Polygon.java. Maybe it's have sense to remove these methods from Shape.java. 
And as you can see Rectangle.set / setPosition / setSize returns void instead of Rectangle ( for method chaining ). If it's really need here it can be added to Shape.java for all classes.

data.title: Libgdx ver 1.0.1 has not MotorJoint.class and MotorJointDef
data.body:
Hi!
I have build one gdx project using gdx-setup-ui. But when i import to eclispe and check libgdx code, i don't see the MotorJoint in gdx-box2d.
Please update them for us to use!

data.title: Pixmap getPixel() method returning strange values
Fix linker flags in controllers extensions
Intersector.overlapConvexPolygon directionality
data.body: Fixed the issue with Intersector.overlapConvexPolygon not honoring directionality with respect to moving p1 out of p2 as per issue described in Issue #1898.

data.title: Only set modules to dev Modules when superDev task is executed, bring back configure on demand
data.body:
- Stops the modules being set to devModules where it is not wanted
- Brings back configuration on demand as its now fixed in the HMTL project

We add the sources from the core project manually in the html project, but with Configure on Demand, the HTML project gets configured first.  This means that we add the sourceset for the core project before that source set is configured in the core project.  This adds the default java sourceset, which is src/main/java, which is not the convention we use.  

To fix this, I've added a task that compileGwt and draftCompileGwt depend on which adds the core source after the core project has been correctly configured.

data.title: Intersector.overlapConvexPolygon(a,b,mtv) - mtv.normal changing based on order
Update Array.java
data.body: methods for inserting and modifying a batch of values at a time.

data.title: Move gwtVersion to DependencyBank.java
Loading objects from tmx map
data.body: When loading objects (not tiles) from tmx map, their Y value is changed somewhere in the process of loading. When looking at the tmx file in text editor or in the Tiled editor, the (rectangle) object has got (for example) property: 'y="800"', but when loading in LibGDX and getting the value via properties or rectangle, the value is not 800. Other object's parameters are working fine.

data.title: Crash on iOS simulator if no audio input device is available
data.body:
I've created a project with gdx-setup and built it using NetBeans. It works fine with other platforms, but trying to launch the IOS build (using Tasks->LaunchIPhoneSimulator) results in a crash of the app within the simulator due to missing audio input. My machine has no microphone.

I expect the project to work at least until it tries to actually use the audio input, which I suppose will never happen in the vast majority of use cases.

![screen shot 2014-05-23 at 13 16 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4583935/3066014/ea6d7c7a-e26b-11e3-9bc3-92a30c7ed50c.png)

data.title: Bring out GWT version to the DependencyBank. Adds support for the Version page on the LibGDX website.
data.body:
This PR is required for https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx-site/pull/13 
- Takes GWT version out to the DependencyBank
- Adds VersionBuilder, which is responsible for creating a .txt file with versions of dependencies (used for the Version page)
- Modifies the Ant build to move the generated .txt file to dist

data.title: Updated CHANGES.
data.body: As per request https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1891#issuecomment-43875972

data.title: updated to RoboVM 0.0.13
Added median methods for Vector3 and Quaternion
data.body:
Added `Quaternion.median(Quaternion[])` and `Vector3.median(Vector3[])` methods to calculate the geometric median. It is robust against outliers and therefore is essential when dealing with real world data, e.g real world rotations and translations. I implemented them in the first place for my augmented reality application where we had calculated object transforms coming from the device camera. The full changelog is the following:
- Corrected Quaternion.pow() name, was exp() before
- Added Quaternion.log() and Quaternion.exp()
- Added Quaternion.logMap() and Quaternion.expMap()
- Added Quaternion.dist()
- Added Quaternion.median() to calculate geometric median
- Added Vector3.median() to calculate geometric median

data.title: getHeader() method of HttpResponse returns only the first line of header
data.body: HttpResponse.getHeader() returns a string which is only the first line of the header. In case of reading cookies from Set-Cookie header every cookie is in new line (they're separated by \n), it returns only the first cookie. Using List<String> iterator from HttpResoinse.getHeaders().get("Set-Cookie") works correctly. It iterates through every line - cookie. For example: The Set-Cookie header: cookie1=abc; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com\n cookie2=abc2; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com\n cookie3=abc3; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com\n The result of HttpResponse.getHeader("Set-Cookie") - first line only (problem) cookie1=abc; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com The result of iterating through the list from HttpResoinse.getHeaders().get("Set-Cookie") - all 3 cookies (ok): [0] cookie1=abc; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com [1] cookie2=abc2; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com [2] cookie3=abc3; expires=Fri, 09-Jun-2017 12:20:40 GMT; path=/; domain=ex.com _I hope it didn't make any stupid mistake and waste your time_

data.title: No way to set a shader just for fonts in scene2d.ui
data.body:
I tried to setup a distance field shader for the fonts on my ui widgets. The problem is, that if I set the shader before drawing the stage, any rendering is done using that shader. Then I subclassed the widgets I wanted to do shading on, but that works only if that widget does not draw a background.

Is there a workaround I am missing?

data.title: Speedup for checking ear intersections
data.body:
isEarTip checks computeSpannedAreaSign 3 times, but it was checking the least likely case last.

Re-order the checks speeds up execution ~15% in my tests (with 1000s of vertices)

data.title: fix #1885, adds no-daemon flag while generating
data.body:
Daemon is hungry, too hungry. This flag disables the daemon for the project generation tasks, it is required as gradle.properties enables the daemon by default, so it would otherwise use it.

Resolves #1885

data.title: Unable to install Libgdx via gradle due to incorrect configuration settings
data.body:
When installing LibGdx, it fails with the following message:
Error occurred during initialization of vm
could not reserve enough space for object heap

To fix the problem, the following options need to be set in gradle.properties:
org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xms128m -Xmx256m

I believe that this is machine dependent, but unsure which machines it applies to.

I am running on Windows 8.1 x64 with 4GB of RAM.

data.title: Generified Hiero code, now more secure and shorter
data.body: Also removed some unnecessary boxing of primitives, unused variables and ran a formatter on all of it. All done carefully, but I didn't compile test it. Should be fine though.

data.title: Added convenience methods for normal/bump maps
data.body:
Added the "missing" convenience methods to quickly create normal and bump maps.
They are not really helping that much, but it appears like a slight inconsistency to not have them.

data.title: Everyone misspells my name :)
data.body: ... but don't worry, I'm used to it :)

data.title: Small optimization to avoid unnecessary square roots.
data.body: Same optimization made in CatmullRomSpline (https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1527) two months ago.

data.title: Added user-defined color example.
data.body:
Since I'm too lazy to write sample code directly to the [color markup wiki page](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Color-Markup-Language) I just tell the user to see the `BitmapFontTest` source code, which is rather self-explanatory.
So I thought it was worth adding a user-defined color example.

data.title: Can't create MotorJoint
Typo in variable name
Packaging iOS project for ah-hoc distribution via Eclipse/RoboVM Tools fails with Box2D + TweenEngine
data.body:
The reason this occurs is because the Gradle plug-in for Eclipse doesn't seem to add the required .jar files into the iOS project's build path. 

By right, the only steps required are the following:

For Box2D, add the following line to the main `build.gradle` file for the `project(":ios")` block.

``` groovy
natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
```

For Tween Engine, add  the line `compile fileTree (dir:'libs/', include:'*.jar')` to the `project(":core")` block.

At this point, using `gradlew ios:createIPA` works correctly.

However, using "RoboVM Tools -> Package for ah-hoc" in Eclipse won't work. Attempting to run the exported .ipa  will result in a crash after the splash screen.

To get it to work, the following needs to be specified instead.

For Box2D, two lines need to be added:

``` groovy
project(":ios") {
... 
compile "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d:$gdxVersion"
natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
...
}
```

For Tween Engine, `tween-engine-api.jar` needs to be manually added into the /libs/ folder of the iOS project. Followed by adding `compile fileTree (dir:'libs', include:'*.jar')` line to the `project(":ios") block in the main`build.gradle` file too. 

This can be tested out with any project that uses Box2D and/or Tween Engine.

More details can be found in [this thread on the RoboVM Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/robovm/fA0Q7acpMC4)

data.title: Packaging iOS project for ah-hoc distribution via Eclipse/RoboVM Tools fails with Box2D
data.body:
The reason this occurs is because the Gradle plug-in for Eclipse doesn't seem to add the required .jar files into the iOS project's build path. 

By right, the only line to be added to the main `build.gradle` file for the iOS depedency is

``` groovy
natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
```

At this point, using `gradlew ios:createIPA` works correctly.
However, using "RoboVM Tools -> Package for ah-hoc" in Eclipse won't work. Attempting to run the exported .ipa  will result in a crash after the splash screen.

To get it to work, the following needs to be specified instead.

``` groovy
project(":ios") {
 ... 
compile "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d:$gdxVersion"
natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
compile fileTree (dir:'libs', include:'*.jar')
...
}
```

This can be tested out with any project that uses Box2D.

More details can be found in [this thread on the RoboVM Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/robovm/fA0Q7acpMC4)
